channel.title: Okta fundamentals :: DevDocs Navigation Menu Test
channel.description: Okta fundamentals Click here to give feedback about this page Section Notes The Okta Basics section gives new-to-IAM or new-to-Okta developers an introduction to Okta-specific basic concepts that they will need to build solutions that integrate with Okta. About This Page Page ID: 144 Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Why is this here?: Respondents with an IAM experience level lower than 5 say that the developer docs “Needs improvement” Respondents with IAM experience level lower that 5 say that they rarely come to the site See Learn (ID: 1)

item.title: Apps and integrations
item.description: What are integrations? Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 755 Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Description: Explains at a high level the different types of applications developers can build as Okta defines them. Also, why you’d want to build them in the first place. Web applications (OIDC, SAML, SWA) API Service Apps Lifecycle apps (SCIM and Workflow Connectors)) Expands “Create your own integration in Okta” to be more of a thought-leading piece about making any type of app public or private and the pros and cons of that decision.

item.title: Okta Identity Engine
item.description: Okta Identity Engine Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 468 Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Changes to be made: Article title change After reading this doc it is rather outdated. We should update this doc and mention Okta’s latest offerings (OIG, PAM, etc) Also even calling it Identity Engine seems rather dated.

item.title: The Okta org
item.description: The Okta org Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 153 Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Changes to be made: Doc needs a thorough review and possibly updated to include new org features. Links to original docs: Okta organizations: https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/okta-organizations/ Why is this here?

item.title: Policies
item.description: Policies Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 469 Is this a new page?: Existing doc: no changes needed to fit the new IA Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Links to original docs: What are policies: https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/policies/ Page type: Concept Content type: Explanation Explanations present a more detailed dive into a single topic compared to Conceptual Overviews. They aim to clarify specific elements of the technology, offering developers practical insights or in-depth clarification on particular points of interest.

item.title: Okta Universal Directory (UD)
item.description: Okta Universal Directory (UD) Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 471 Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Changes to be made: Title change Add summary content (and links) on how UD integrates with Hub and spoke Add summary content (and links) on how UD can be synced between other domains/systems/AD, etc Links to original docs:

item.title: Find your Okta domain
item.description: Find your Okta domain Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 289 Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Changes to be made: Add reasons why you need to know or use this “Okta domain” Links to original docs: Find your Okta domain: https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/find-your-domain/main/ Page type: Task

item.title: Find your app credentials
item.description: Find your app credentials Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 290 Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Changes to be made: Add reasons why you need to know or use the “Application credentials” Links to original docs: Find your application credentials: https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/find-your-app-credentials/ Page type: Task

item.title: Admin console
item.description: Admin console Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 152 Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Description: An overview of the Admin console for developers. There is currently no equivalent doc on help.okta.com for admin users. Page type: Concept Content type: Explanation Explanations present a more detailed dive into a single topic compared to Conceptual Overviews.

item.title: Okta APIs
item.description: Okta APIs Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 143 Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Description: Summary overview of the different sets of Okta APIs and their purpose. Links to the API reference section on Redocly. Why is this here?: At the Oktane MatchIt game, 35.5% of respondents could not define Okta APIs.

item.title: Okta SDKs
item.description: Okta SDKs Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 166 Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Description: This page briefly describes the existing, supported Okta SDKs, and redirects the reader to Reference > SDKs where more information is given. Why is this here?: Internal workshop session: Session 1 - Team 1 chose the Custom App SDKs group.

item.title: Okta Sign-in Widget
item.description: Okta Sign-In Widget Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 169 Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Internal app builders, Saas Builder Why is this here?: In the Oktane GroupIt game, the Embedded Sign-in Widget was placed in a significant amount of groups, which may indicate disagreement over the meaning. Page type: Concept Content type: Explanation Explanations present a more detailed dive into a single topic compared to Conceptual Overviews.
